item.title: How I Deploy and Host Projects
item.description:
I’m currently hosting several sites and services on DigitalOcean. This includes (but is not limited to):

  1. My blog (this site)
  2. A demo site for my Poison Hugo theme
  3. A personal project
  4. An instance of Plausible for site analytics
  5. An instance of Remark42 for comments

All of this runs on a \$6/month droplet using Docker Compose and Nginx.

Despite my ignorance when first setting things up, this approach has aged well. It‚Äôs easy to add new projects, and I no longer dread making deployments. Instead of spending time administering existing services, I‚Äôm busy building new ones.

In this post, I’ll provide an overview of my setup, explain how it works, and discuss some planned improvements.

item.title: Inertia
item.description:
I don’t have much to say in this post. I’ve had this blog for several months and haven’t written a word. This is my attempt to break that streak.

Newton said that an object in motion will stay in motion unless acted upon by an outside force. So, assuming I’m not hit by a bus anytime soon, I’ll be writing more (I think).
